review.reviewBody: They are glorified plasticwear. Folding is nice, but be careful because a sharp knife will easily cut them.
review.name: They are glorified plasticwear. Folding

review.reviewBody: The utensils are very good quality and lightweight.
review.name: The utensils are very good

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight compact utensils. I've used them for backpacking and weekend car camping trips. The past two I've lent out during trips weren't returned because they're so great, hence buying this 4pack. Hopefully this 4pack will last a bit longer but I'd buy again.
review.name: Great camping utensils

review.reviewBody: They allow me to dig to the bottom of the mealbag without me greasing up my knuckles on the insides!!
review.name: I would recommend to anyone.

review.reviewBody: I was concerned these utensils would be flimsy, but this is certainly not the case. Use both the spoon and fork every day for lunch when I'm not hiking.
review.name: Sturdy

review.reviewBody: Useful on the trail and my go to utensils for my work lunch bag - light, durable and get food where it needs to go.
review.name: well built. light and do the job.

review.reviewBody: Love the colors and function. Fold feature allows you to put the spoons inside the cookware when traveling. The fork folds perfectly. The spoon however, does not flush. Not a big deal though.
review.name: Cute and functional!

review.reviewBody: We used these spoons when traveling and or camping. We had Light My Fire spoons and forks before but they broke. And to our surprise, rather easily. MSR spoons are very well built. Excellent, thought through folding design. Practical. Sturdy. Just one thing though- when folded, the two ends of the spoon are flush, whereas the form doesn't flush well.
review.name: Very well built. Thought through design. Practical. Sturdy

review.reviewBody: The folding spork is a must have piece of gear. The materials are of good quality, not cheap of flimsy feeling like some other brands. The Spork is easy to clean in the field and the hinge mechanism is not a trap for food particles like other sliding type mechanisms. The spork is compact when folded and negligible in weight, the perfect addition to an ultralight kit. When unfolded the spork is long enough to stir or scrape the bottom of narrow cooking vessels thereby serving double duty in the meal prep and eating. Inexpensive, lightweight, multifunctional and quality construction equals a no brained for me
review.name: Maximize your loadout

review.reviewBody: Love these! Size, texture, and functionality! I carry a spoon and fork with me everywhere I go. Good stuff - would recommend
review.name: Everyday use

name: Folding Utensil Kit

review.reviewBody: Fits great and looks amazing! I have no complaints, I wore it through this ski season and look forward to using it again next year.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Great helmet so far . Fits nice looks good .works well with my io mag xl goggles speaking of goggles are you guys ever going to get lenses in for the Io mag xl ? All n all love smith products would definitely recommend smith products to anyone that’s looking 👀
review.name: Brain bucket

review.reviewBody: Fit well and kept my head warm during snowboarding. Started giving me a headache because it was a little too tight. Probably my fault, but it felt good when I tried it on. Over time, it just presses on my head 🤷‍♂️
review.name: Nice helmet for short trips

review.reviewBody: Fit is great, doesn’t move around. Very comfortable. Sleek design and cool colors
review.name: Fit is great, doesn’t move

review.reviewBody: Smith shipped super quick and the Scout helmet definitely exceeded expectation. I couldn’t ask for a better experience.
review.name: Smith shipped super quick and

review.reviewBody: Fit is excellent and the integration with my Smith goggles is superb. The buckle must not have been threaded correctly though… while riding a chairlift I tugged on my balaclava and the strap pulled right through. The cushion for the strap flew away, as did the tiny rubber band. I rethreaded the strap through the buckle and now it works like a charm, though I need to track down a new cushion piece. Excellent helmet, just check to be sure the strap is secure.
review.name: Superb helmet, but check the strap

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, great price, and one of the better looking helmets.
review.name: Comfortable, great price, and one

review.reviewBody: I spent 2 years looking for the perfect helmet. I tried on a lot and from many different companies. I finally found this and absolutely love it. The fit is great for me. Its warm and has room for a thin beanie if the temps are sub zero. It has a nice clean look and I get compliments on it all the time.
review.name: love it

review.reviewBody: Awesome helmet. Great quality and service. Best fit out of all the brands I tried on.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Great looking safety must-have for skiers and snow borders!
review.name: Great looking safety must-have for

review.reviewBody:
Love, Love, Love these ARMADA ARV 106s!  Everything you need, nothing you don't.  Fat enough  to float through some serious POW while keeping it loose and slashable with the 3D smear tech tip and tail. NO POW? No problem, the damp poplar/ ash core keeps these planted on the firmest of high pressure days and will dance through park laps with durability in the build.  They'll take lickin' and keep on rippin'!!!

Pretty much the most versatile platform in the ARMADA lineup.  I've always got a set in the bed of the truck...

Good jacket, perfect for work and easy to deploy while hiking. 
Got a medium so I have room for layers but a small would've fit just right at 5'8 150lbs.

Insulates heat well for a thin jacket, I find myself taking it off often to keep from sweating underneath on hikes

review.itemreviewed: Speed Eco Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Took these bad boys to Bar Harbor, Maine and hiked A LOT around Acadia National Park on my honeymoon. They were very comfortable, highly recommend & they are waterproof
review.name: Great comfort!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Eco Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for a recent trip to Banff, Canada and they were amazing. They arrived only a few days before the trip so I was worried I would have issues with breaking them in but no problems! We did an 11 mile hike the second day of wearing them and I only got one tiny blister (which let’s be honest, probably would have happened anyway). I wore them multiple times on my trip and every time I was so happy with them. Highly recommend!
review.name: Amazing-love these!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Eco Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are super comfortable and very lightweight for a mid hiking shoe.  The outer is only slightly tougher than a normal running shoe, but waterproof.  Of course the outsole is much grippier.  They are exactly what I was expecting from the description.  I needed something with more ankle support but didn't need a heavy duty leather hiking boot.  Very pleased!
review.name: Perfect lightweight hiker with added ankle support

review.itemreviewed: Speed Eco Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought them for trip to Alaska.  Perfect for elements yet comfortable and stylish at a great price.
review.name: Great comfort and stylish

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. Fun color options and it keeps me warm.
review.name: I would buy this jacket again.

review.reviewBody: Jacket was super cute and I had high hopes, but the fit just isn't right and it is definitely not warm enough for anything under 40 degrees. I'm a size small in all other jackets, occasionally a medium. I bought this in a medium so I could layer underneath if need be, and I couldn't stretch my arms out without the jacket feeling like it was going to rip down the back. I then exchanged for a large and I was swimming in it, the neck part constantly rubbing against my cheeks to where I couldn't turn my head. I decided to return and get a jacket elsewhere
review.name: Would absolutely not recommend

review.reviewBody: Fantastic jacket keeps you warm in most weather fit and color are perfect
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I don't like the neck part. It sticks in my face and won't bend down.
review.name: Not a fan

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! Bought it due to my Denali jacket not being enough and the heavy parka being too much. This is the perfect weight. The only issue I have is that the collar will lay down and constantly stabs me in the neck.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a winter work trip and for extra cold days at home. The quality is excellent and there is something about the black color of North Face jackets that looks very polished. I needed something that keeps me warm but looks stylish enough to wear on the street and in the office. I think this fits the bill! My only complaint is that I wish there were snap buttons near the collar so I could get it out of the way of my face when I don't want it zipped up all the way.
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect jacket for adding warmth without the bulk. It's a 'puffer" coat that doesn't make me look like the marshmallow man! ;) I have started buying them as gifts also as you just can't go wrong and everyone loves them.
review.name: Always a winner!

review.reviewBody: Went to Oregon and it was the perfect weight when we were doung all our outdoor activities
review.name: Live this slim puffer

review.reviewBody: We love this jacket, not only does it look great and is very warm-it also can be worn while sitting indoors....thumbs up North Face!!!!
review.name: I would definetly recommend this jacket to friends, etc.....

review.reviewBody: recently purchased the Women's Aconcagua 3 Jacket, and I am absolutely thrilled with it! This jacket strikes the perfect balance between warmth and style. The 600-fill down insulation keeps me cozy without being overly bulky, making it ideal for both outdoor activities and everyday wear. The fit is flattering, with enough room to layer underneath without feeling restrictive. I particularly love the lightweight feel, which makes it easy to pack for travel. The water-resistant finish is a bonus for those unpredictable winter days. Overall, this jacket is a fantastic addition to my winter wardrobe! Highly recommend!
review.name: Highly recommend!

name: Aconcagua 3 Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have purchased these boots in the past but it has been a couple of years since I had a pair.  What a difference! These boots are marvelous for desert mountain trails.
review.name: Fantastic hiking boots

review.reviewBody:
I bought the v2 boots for a deployment to Afghanistan in 2014, where I went on patrol over many different kinds of terrain, but mostly farmland and hills. Over the next ten years, these were my go-to boots for walking and hiking in Jordan, Cyprus, Bahrain, Scotland, Ireland, Iceland, and also my everyday hikers/walkers in the US during mud or snow. After absolutely beating them to death - to death - I admit that it's finally time to send them to the Happy Hunting Grounds for shoes. Fantastic quality. Thank you, Vasque. (The Taliban does not thank you, btw.) Phenomenal quality. You cannot go wrong with this line. 

I will miss you, my friends. *insert meme of proud man pretending not to cry*
review.name: Best hiking boots I've ever had, period.
comment: Thank you for the review! It's amazing to hear the boots have traveled with you all over the world, we appreciate the support!

review.reviewBody: Ordered an 11 Mens and could not even get my foot into the shoe to see if it fit.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: I have an ongoing left ankle problem. The Vasque Breeze enables me to function without any cause for concern. This is my second pair of Vasque boots, and I will probably purchase another pair when the need arises in the future.
review.name: Vasque boots are winners.

review.reviewBody: I'm too lazy to try other brands if what I have works well. I've worn Vasque Breeze boots for the last 10 years, and only replace them when the previous one gets worn out. This is my 3rd pair, and this model continues to work well for me. I've heard the comments about these boots not having Vibram soles anymore, but I have yet to notice anything functionally different as a result of that change. This size 9.5 is slightly larger (just by ~3mm) than the size 9.5 I wore for the Vasque Breeze 2.0, and I debated sizing up, but after hiking (and running bc it was getting dark) in them, I decided to keep the same size. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Still a great boot

review.reviewBody:
So nice, I had to compose a refrain:
I once met a girl named Beasley,
who liked my Vasque so Breezy.
We joined together one day, and
that's how we'll stay....
Alas, just a poem-rest easy!
They really are a nice hiker. Were they the most comfortable footwear right out of the box? No. After about fifty miles of pavement they are getting cozy, though. The fit is right on. Not a single blister or even a sore spot. Thanks for the footwear, guys.
review.name: Such a Nice Boot

review.reviewBody: I've been through many iterations of the Vasque Breeze, for hiking, search/rescue, and everyday wear. I'm now looking for a new pair of the 7742, but I see much to my disappointment that the outer sole is no longer Vibram. The part number is the same, but the sole isn't. I won't bet my life on anything other than Vibram, so that's the end of the Breeze for me. RIP.
review.name: Where did the vibram sole go?
comment: Thank you for your honest review. We hope you will give our brand another chance in the future.

review.reviewBody: When the I originally bought a pair of Breezes 4 years ago I loved them so much, that when I can back from my 2 week hike I went out and bought a second pair to keep that continuity going. Since then both pairs served me well. I bought these and so incredibly disappointed that I returned them after one walk around the the block. Everything is cheaper. The fit is off. It's just a bad shoe. I'm writing this review in hopes they will improve their product so I can come back.
review.name: Lost a Step
comment:
We are sorry to hear that the current Breeze lineup did not meet your expectations. We will make sure to pass this information along to our Product Development teams.
Thank you for the review!

review.reviewBody: I have wore the Breeze shoe now for the 15 years. I had just purchased my last ones a little over a month ago and I can`t wear them. I wear them everyday for work on concrete and by the end of the day my feet are very sore. When you stop making them with the Vibram soles, they are not the same.
review.name: Changing the soles
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear your boots are not performing as expected. We will reach out to you directly to do what we can to assist via email.

review.reviewBody: A few months in with very minimal wear and walking through wet grass for 10 feet and I have wet feet. What a complete waste of my hard earned $. This brand will never be on my feet again
review.name: Vasque Breeze are terrible !
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear your boots are not performing as expected. We will reach out to you directly to do what we can to assist via email.

name: Breeze Hiking Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Gregory Maya 25L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Maya 25L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Maya 25L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love this bag---it has great pockets and all of the features I wanted. Unfortunately, I am 5'4" and about 105 pounds, and this pack did not fit me at all, even after I adjusted the torso.  The hip belt wrapped around my ribs, and there was nothing I could do adjustment-wise to get it to sit on my hips.  The upper back also rubbed and dug into my neck.  I tried on a Maya 20 and it fit much better, so I may have to give up some volume for a better fit.
review.name: Not for small people

review.reviewBody: this backpack can be so streamline. It’s a very comfortable backpack probably stands above any other backpack I’ve used considering I’ve had uncomfortable back issues for years, and this one sat so nicely on my pelvis, and the strap around my waist was so comfortable.
review.name: happy back lovely backpack

review.reviewBody: This pack is the perfect size for day hikes.  Love the pockets on the hips.  They are nice and large.
review.name: Perfect day pack

review.reviewBody: This bag is comfy on my 5’5” frame. I have a hard time with packs hitting the back of my head because of my shorter torso. Great for short hikes with enough room for me the dog stuff. I love all of the quick access compartments for the essentials. The hip belt is comfy as well as the padding on the back. I love my hydration clip, the reservoir paired with this is a must! The hydration clip is a nice feature to just drop and hand your reservoir easily. For a small bag it has amazing organized storage.  The accessory loops are great too.
review.name: Well thought out day pack

review.reviewBody: I have a Maya 16, which I love, so bought this as a replacement because I now need more room (I hike with 3 dogs).   I love the fit  and comfort and everything else about it, but was so disappointed when, after 2 hikes, the horizontal straps that go across the backpack straps were shredded by my water hose and bear spray on one side and a Garmin Inreach  mini on the other.  I have worn this configuration with my Maya 16 for years with no incident.   Quality has gone downhill, or is this a faulty pack?
review.name: I wanted to love it.
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. As a brand, we hold our products to a high standard of quality and durability to meet the demands of frequent travelers. We'd love the opportunity to make this right for you. Please contact us at warranty@gregorypacks.com. Thanks again!

review.reviewBody: Pack is comfortable, the zippers work smoothly, and it’s a good size for a longish day hike.  What I like most is the separate compartment for a hydration bladder.  I have other packs that have a place to hang a bladder, but it’s a huge pain to cram the bladder into them, so if I’m using a bladder instead of water bottles, I take this pack.
review.name: Happy with this pack

review.reviewBody: I just got my Maya 25 and am happy with the quality.  I like how the bag has some structure but is not rigid.  I haven't actually worn it on a hike yet but around the house it feels comfortable.  My initial thoughts are, I wish there was a little more cushion on the straps and the waistband pockets are a bit hard to reach while the pack is on.  In my mind, when ordering, I imagined that the waistband pockets would allow me easy access to things while walking.  However, they are quite a ways back and need to curve around my body.  That means that my phone, though it fits, is hard to get in and out of the pocket while I'm walking.  I take a lot of photos so was hoping I could tuck my phone away but be able to take it out quickly when needed.  Realizing I may need to find another way.  Overall happy with my purchase and excited to get some trail time in.
review.name: Happy overall

review.reviewBody: I got the pack because I wanted something with the support and technology of a hiking pack but the classic backpack look. So far I love it! Some favorite features- the water bottle pockets are stretchy enough to hold Nalgenes even when the pack is at full capacity which is great. No more struggling to get bottles in and out and having to take the pack off to wrestle with them. The pockets on the hip belts are a nice touch for a day pack and the stuff it pocket is nice and stretchy and holds a lot. The size and look of the 25 and the 20 are almost the same so if you’re torn between the two, I’d recommend the larger size for the extra room. The only issue I’ve had is with the length of the pack. I’m right at the max length the adjustable back panel adjusts to (5’9 tall, roughly 18.5 length) and sometimes the hip belt rides up. Still comfortable but if your torso is much longer or you might want to find a different fit. Overall a super adjustable, comfortable pack with a lot of well thought out features.
review.name: Great pack, a little better fit for shorter torsos

review.reviewBody: I have a Maya 22 that I love and was excited when the newer models came out. I bought the 25L for an upcoming trip to Spain. The back panel was different than the previous model but overall the fit was ok. The adjustable panel for the torso length is different than in the old 22 , shorter and it forms a bulge in the back that if not using a water bladder can be uncomfortable. The Velcro doesn’t stay in place long even when not fully packed. When using the pack every day this is a problem. The top handle started detaching on day 2. Maybe I got a defective pack, as my 22L is still going strong.
review.name: Wanted to like it but was disappointed
comment: Thanks for leaving the review on our site.  Please contact our customer service to discuss a possible warranty replacement.

review.reviewBody: The ultimate day trip bag! Precision the design of this bag and the compartments make it literally impeccable. Fits like a glove. Perfect for all outdoor excursions.
review.name: Ultimate day trip bag

name: Maya 25L Daypack

review.reviewBody: I bought this hat for a hiking trip in Arizona. Boy was I glad I had this silly looking hat with me. It kept me cooler than any baseball hat ever did and covered the back of my neck to save me from sunburn. Added bonus: a hole for the ponytail.
review.name: This hat kept the sun at bay

review.reviewBody: Love this hat. This is my second one in this style. It fits so great & is adjustable for whatever head size you need. The quality is superb. I love the color. If they came out with one in purple I would jump on it.
review.name: Best hat ever for protection from the sun

review.reviewBody: This hat is both essential for winter in Florida and summers in New England.
review.name: Great Sun Protection

review.reviewBody: I love this hat!  It is adjustable, it covers my ears and the crown is vented
review.name: Great hat

review.reviewBody: I love these beach hats. I finally bought a new one! I’ve been wearing the ones I bought 25 years ago! Sunday Afternoon hats truly last a lifetime and provide skin protection from the sun. I advise you to invest in your skin health and buy a few!! Buy your friends a hat too!
review.name: Teal

review.reviewBody: Love that hat. VERY disappointed that they quit offering beachy colors.  Would like blue, peach...you know BEACHY colors.
review.name: Great hat that fits us petite folks!!

review.reviewBody: I love the hat!  Beautiful color and perfect sun blockage. The only thing i would ask for is a place to tuck the neck cover into, when you want to wear it like a baseball cap.
review.name: Beautiful!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight hat, excellent coverage. Love the fabric and the drawstring to prevent it from flying off
review.name: Love this hat

review.reviewBody:
Sunday Afternoons hats are high quality and this one fits right in. Love the color! I have a big head and the L/XL has room to spare. I am able to cinch it down to just the right size. Ponytail holder could be slightly bigger so I can get my fingers in to pull my hair through, but works. 
I will admit that I feel slightly dorky in this hat, but that is about me, not the hat. I have to keep the sun off (high risk of skin cancer) and this hat is much more effective than sunscreen (and much less greasy!). Appreciate the chin strap too for windy days.
review.name: Fits my big head!

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these sports hats because I wear them every day and I love the comfort and coverage while I garden and also walk my dogs. They are nice looking hats. Great for protecting your face and neck from the Southern California sun . I was glad to find this company with their well made products
review.name: Love my hats!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The trash dry bag does its job perfectly, keeping messy things like coffee grounds and packaged tuna wrappers and a few beer cans contained and tidy. We used it for car camping, and since it is not critter proof, put it in the car overnight. No messes, no smell (to us humans anyway). We will be strapping it along for a bike packing trip later this summer, and all the strap points will make it very easy to bring along and hang overnight.
review.name: Perfect for the job

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this sack as top loading pocket. I put my tent and snack bag and Cnoc in it.
Its water proof and also daisy chain will help to prevent from falling the sack when bushwhacking.
Son this is my second time when I hike PCT.highly recommend.
review.name: Trash Dry Sack - 10L

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these trash bags. I got two, one for aluminum and one for general trash to keep separated on the road, all the time, camping or not.
review.name: You didn't even know you wanted this

review.reviewBody: I've owned at least a dozen pair of Altras and this is hands down my favorite. More cushion than the Lone Peak but with the same light, roomy feel. Great control on trails and cush enough for concrete. In the past I've had issues with durability, but it seems like they have solved some of the delaminating problems.
review.name: Favorite running shoes

review.reviewBody: I liked using these shoes on my 4 day hike.
review.name: Good shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] There are things I do need to spend money on. One of those things is shoes. It is very important to buy the right shoes for my feet. Shoes that I buying have to be breathable,  comfortable, and made with good material because I use them every day. One of the shoes that I love and buy for my husband is Altra Running.  My husband loves them. He loves them . Every morning, he takes them for running. Wide, comfortable,  light, and breathable. Made with very good materials and worth every penny.
review.name: It's worth every penny

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit and comfort have been great. They look super clean and sleek with just the right amount of pop of color. The mesh siding provides breathability with good rubberizing around the side and toes. So far so good!
review.name: Fit’s great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Alta Timp 5 trail running shoes are well worth the price. They are grippy and fit great. Lots of cushion in the sole. These shoes really look good too. They are well designed for running off road and will be a great addition to our running routine.
review.name: Nice looking, great fit trail shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] ￼ I absolutely love these shoes, they are so darn comfy. I have a wide foot and these fit wonderful. The color the design goes with everything very neutral. The quality of the shoe is amazing and definitely worth the money. They are breathable. And the traction is great.
review.name: These shoes are so comfy

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely nothing else compare to this brand shoes..my whole wears them. The one and only brand for me N mine no other even compare to them
May God Bless Us All

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these sneakers they are soft and comfortable perfect for hiking. I definitely recommend getting for outdoor activities and rough use. You will like it
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Use them as hiking and backpacking shoes, 3-4 days of light use to break them in, than a 3 day backpacking trip with substantial load, few days later a SAR trip, and a day hike. Great shoes. No hot spots, great room for my wide feet and toes and nice support. I usually wear boots with my heavy pack so was pleasantly surprised. Seem little tight first through the middle of my feet first, especially around the top, but went away after couple days of light wear. Only issue is the loop on the back. Could be slightly bigger to allow a finger to go through, would allow shoes to be put on a lot easier.
review.name: Very nice!

review.reviewBody: I bought these after a pair of Lone peak 8's. I don't know what happend with Altra but there shoes continue to dissapoint. As someone who has worn them from the start, they continue to go downhill.

review.reviewBody: I am a ski team coach at Squaw Valley. In the age of COVID we are required to wear masks all day, and this is the only one of numerous I have tried that I can comfortably keep on all day long! It’s double layer so it fits COVID requirements, while light enough to be able to breathe through without my face getting too hot. On top of that, I have gotten many compliments from other coaches and parents that the colors make it easy to spot so the kids won’t get lost wondering where their coach went. Overall, couldn’t be happier with this purchase.
review.name: Ski Team Coach

review.reviewBody: I bought Hex Camo Grey and absolutely love the fabric, feel and breathability. However I am a 5'4 lady and honestly it doesnt fit my face to hold up to be able to use as a mask for outdoor functions. If it came in a kids I would try that and give hubby this one. But I love the color. Might try the baklava when it comes back in stock. Also wish this color came in civil mask
review.name: Loose fit for Lady

review.reviewBody: I bought and used this in a recent snowboarding trip. I need something with a little more protection and warmth than a normal tube would provide. It worked perfectly. Fits under my goggles well and hold enough heat in without making you too hot. Still breathable and the best part; I never had to suggest anything to eat because everyone around me really wanted Pizza for some reason.
review.name: This will make others hungry

review.reviewBody: The fabric is a thick durable knit, double layered. Works great as a neck warmer, not so great as a face cover. I can't find a way to keep over my nose and have it stay there.
review.name: Great Quality

review.reviewBody: Love this! It keeps you warm but it is never hard to breath and my sunglasses didn't fog up when wearing it. Looking to buy more!
review.name: So warm & breathable

review.reviewBody: My BlackStrap neck gaiter was purchased solely for the mandatory face covering now required in many jurisdictions. Whether around your neck or covering your nose and mouth, it fits great, feels comfortable on my face, and looks sharp. Thank you for a useful and well-made product.
review.name: Stay safe, be safe, look cool!

review.reviewBody: BS makes great products. I'm a small stature adult. This will be my second gaiter from BS. My first one is a youth tube. Fit a little snug but a great product. Only complaint about the adult one is that it is a little large and doesn't fit me properly. The material and look are amazing. I'm gonna purchase one of the regular tubes today. If you are looking for a sturdy tube the double tube is the way to go. Lightweight summer tube the regular is the way to go
review.name: BS is great

review.reviewBody: You never know what you're going to get ordering online for the first time from a new (to me) store but I'm very impressed. Great service when my initial choice of pattern want available. Fast delivery. Follow up to ensure the customer is happy. I'll shop here again and would recommend to my friends.
review.name: Excellent quality and great looks.

review.reviewBody: Comfort. Warmth. Style. It has it all! More are in my future!

review.reviewBody: I was surprised how green this jacket was when it arrived. It looked turquoise in the photos. There are lots of features I like: pockets everywhere, hand gators, and especially the height of the collar/hood around the face. I share everyone's displeasure with the underarm zippers. If I were MH I would have chosen a more flexible zipper to insert in the underarm opening when manufacturing this jacket. As far as size goes, I would say the jacket is true to size. If you do want lots of room, size up. I am 5'4" and 120lbs. I got a small and wish I had ordered a medium because I did want lots of room. Other reviews made me confused on this issue. My final impression is that this jacket is true to size, somewhat fitted and flattering. If you want lots of room, size up. Despite the stiff zippers and unexpected color, I am happy with this jacket.
review.name: GREEN, stiff zippers, true to size.

review.reviewBody: I love mountain hard-wear overall, this one is more of a hard shell but has insulation. I feel like the underarm zipper is a bit uncomfortable but other than great quality. I have several MHW jackets and in comparison the other jackets are quite waterproof as well.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: Great ski coat! Long to cover my bum, just warm enough but not too much. I love all the various pockets! Pass pocket in arm is perfect. It’s a bit over sized but I’m ok with that look. Very roomy to layer under.
review.name: Great all around ski coat!

review.reviewBody: I found this too boxy looking, very unflattering on me.  Went with my regular size medium. Also the armpit zippers were really uncomfortable. Perhaps that is due to the Gortex material. I ended up returning it.
review.name: Didn’t work out

review.reviewBody: Pockets in all the right places. I haven't tested this yet with really inclement weather, but it is perfect for adding and subtracting layers. Size-wise it is generous. I often need a medium to make room for layers, particularly through the shoulders and bust, but the small has plenty of room and the internal sleeve cuffs are long enough! I am 5'7" and weigh 140, bust 37".  It is warmer than I expected, but I'm happy about that--I run cold. The storm collar is JUST RIGHT, roomy but not gaping, soft on the inside, easy to find the zipper pull with gloves on. I skied four straight days using the storm collar zipped to the top, without a neck gaiter and it kept the wind out without getting chin chap. A great coat that does it's job perfectly.
review.name: Would highly recommend!

review.reviewBody: Great jacket. Comfortable, warm and cute! Love it!
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: I have yet to wear this out, but I am love the cut of the jacket. It's flattering and slimming. Quite impressed with the design and cut. This jacket is on par with my lululemon gear.
review.name: Flattering and slimming

review.reviewBody: Wore this jacket all last winter and am really happy with how it performed in dumping snow and even rain. Durable fabric and waterproof with enough insulation that it’s warm on reasonable days or colder days you can still layer. Pit zips are the best too! Also the flap pockets are big for all the things!  I’m wearing size M and am 5’7 145 lbs.
review.name: Fully featured and durable!

review.reviewBody: Purchased in two different sizes to try on. One fit just right and the other was bigger to be able to layer more. However on both jackets, the zipper on the armpit was stabbing my arm and was too uncomfortable to wear. Tried to reposition the fabric/zipper but it just made my arm more sore. Had to return.
review.name: Armpit zipper stabs upper arm

name: Cloud Bank GORE-TEX Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Digital Pressure Over Drive Floor Pump
review.reviewBody:
The materials on this pump are amazing. Quality is top notch.  
But unfortunately it causes extreme frustration both in the shop and on the ride. 

First, the screw on chuck is a terrible design for tubeless setups. It doesn't "slip effortlessly on" as mentioned in the description. It has to be screwed on. 
The trouble is when you unscrew the chuck it can't help but also unscrew your presta valve to one degree or another. 
Tubeless valves are quite sensitive to changes in their position - if you accidentally unscrew, even slightly, the result can be a slow leak which means a flat tire in the middle of your ride. Lovely. 

You can be sure to tighten your presta valve again after using this pump, but this too can cause problems with slow leaks. Once a presta valve is installed and holding air it needs to be left in position. 

Second, the digital pressure gauge is horrendously inaccurate. This pump may as well not even have a pressure gauge. 
For some reason, the hose retains a lot of air, and I suspect this might be part of the problem. 
All of this air releases from the hose as you unscrew. 
And if you check the pressure with an accu-gage, you'll find that its nowhere near what the pump indicated. I mean... not even close. 

I haven't tried to seat a large tubeless tire with it yet. That might be the one thing it does well.

If anyone has any ideas or solutions to these frustrations I'd appreciate it. This thing was not cheap. Maybe I'm just not using it right.
review.name: Extremely Frustrating

name: Digital Pressure Over Drive Floor Pump

review.reviewBody: This is exactly the mid-weight coat I was looking for to wear in the fall and late winter/early spring. The longer length, hood, and wind resistance are great for keeping warm, and the light, soft lining also provides the perfect amount of warmth for temps in the 30s and 40s without overheating like down insulation would at those temps. I wear this coat walking to and from a bus stop six blocks away for my commute to and from work. It looks fine with my dressy work clothes while still functioning very practically. I don't particularly care for or need the belt/sash in the back, and the bulkiness of it actually hurts my back when sitting against it while driving, so I have to unbutton it and let it hang on the sides. I also don't love the Velcro on the entire length of the front flap covering the zipper, but I realize it's necessary for wind and water resistance. Other than those two minor issues, I love this coat, including the grey color which goes with everything. I already have enough black coats, so the color options for this coat are great.
review.name: Perfect mid-weight coat for shoulder seasons

review.reviewBody: The only things I don't like about this coat are the Velcro on the front (previous coat had snaps) and the pocket zippers kept breaking off. Very warm though for a longer rain type coat.
review.name: Great warm rain coat

review.reviewBody: The fit is very good. Love the soft inside liner, very warm. The only downside is the Velcro on the outside.

review.reviewBody: The jacket is nice, but not what I was looking for in a jacket. This jacket has almost a swimwear material, which I don't like I was looking for something more water resistant and thick. The lining inside is great, but not to wear with hoodies.
review.name: Great Jacket, not what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: the front of the coat is fine. however the back of the coat does not lay right. it has some kind of defect. I have tried this style on multiple times thinking it was a defect in one coat but they are all this way.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Very warm. And stylish! I received a bit of compliments every time I wear it!
review.name: Highly recommend

review.name: Would not purchase again.

review.reviewBody: Super cute jacket and the inside is sooo soft. Love it!!!!
review.name: Love everything North Face!!!

I wish north face make the same jacket with a nicer zipper , without Velcro and with a darker color nice fabric for the outside of this jacket.

review.reviewBody: This is my new go to all mountain destroyer...It's fast, powerful and fun. Traditional Camber combined with 3BT and a stiffer-ish flex makes for a very predictable board with lots of pop and stability. The directional twin shape is great in the park (specifically jumps) and somehow handles every other possible type of terrain without ever getting flustered. I've set my Astro Asymwrap Bindings (great choice for this board) back a little to give it more nose for those deep days. I live in CO and ride the 161W but would consider the 164W for riding more aggressive terrain... maybe I should just have both.
review.name: Powerful + Predictable = Traditional Fun

review.reviewBody: Just got this saddle today via FedEx. Finished a 27 mile test ride and all is very good. Have been riding a Trek Bontrager all carbon shell saddle for nearly 10 years. This split saddle, the Sella Italia, has better ride comfort. I had multiple pelvis breaks about a year ago and possibly shifted some of the bones that had been supporting that area. This floating seat in the SP-01 seems to help getting myself comfy again. I prefer the carbon shell, no pad, saddles. The synthetic padding or cover seems to overheat my body parts. The all leather, such as Brooks, seem to be very good also.
review.name: Excellent ride

review.reviewBody: They loved their new tent! I was wondering what light weight footprint to use with it or what size to look for.
review.name: Daughter and Son-in-law love it!

review.reviewBody: The Copper Spur is a solid, comfortable, easy to set-up tent in all of the conditions I've used it in. I've taken this tent to Yellowstone, Glacier, and other locations in Montana during summer months and have had a very positive experience thus far. I've probably used the tent about 20 times by now. I know that's really not too much wear and tear to put on a tent, but it's performed perfectly for what I've needed it for over the past 2 years or so. I would definitely recommend this tent to anyone looking for a UL tent with enough space to fit 2 people and a dog, or 2 adults and a kid, or 3 adults (tight).
review.name: One of the Best I've Ever Owned

review.reviewBody:
Three season, freestanding, ultralight tent
Already one of our best-selling, full-featured, ultralight backpacking tents, the Copper Spur HV UL3 3-person tent just got better. Redesigned with cutting-edge features inside and out, using proprietary materials that are lighter, stronger, and equipped with hardware that makes set-up even easier. The high volume design provides ample living space in this freestanding structure. Traditional, media, and 3D bin pockets help to organize your gear without cramping your sleep space or capacity to sit up inside. Awning-style vestibules can be customized to expand living space, great for both drizzle and sun protection. Your ultimate UL home away from home.
review.name: Copper Spur HV UL3

review.reviewBody: Easy to set up, roomy, with easy access for multiple people (2 vestibules) made this tent feel luxurious. That it held up perfectly in wind and rain makes it an instant favorite.
review.name: Withstood rain and wind effortlessly

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a tent for my family (2 adults 1 newborn) and went for this Big Agnes.
There’s lots to love about it, honestly more than I expected.

I was considering the Tarptent Rainshadow 3 (single wall so (1) super light but (2) prone to condensation and (3) no stargazing from tent) but ended being discouraged by it not being freestanding (I’ve definitely been in situations you can’t stake the tent)... and also by its “tapered” shape (great for saving weight but makes the tent less livable, big downside w a baby).

I have been on 2 trips so far with the Big Agnes, here are my learnings.

PROs:
• incredibly light
• pre-bent poles make the tent super spacious (it’s easy to sit in it and play with the baby, for instance)
• symmetric, which means same headroom at top and bottom of tent (again, great for feeding the baby in the tent, so that you’re not confined to the tall part of the tent)
• lots of great pockets (both near sleeping area and above it)
• we used a pocket to put our phone there and used an apple watch as a baby monitor — amazing :)
• door holders to keep doors open — nice detail!
• little velcro patches to keep doors closed without zipping them up (AMAZING to not wake baby up)
• vestibules can be turned into porches (if you have 2 or 4 poles)
• in general, vestibules are super flexible and can be configured in many ways
• tarp/inner tent/fly nicely attach to one another with plastic clips
• can be easily setup in windy conditions (just stake the tarp first, then the inner tent, the put poles)

CONs:
• light material is THIN so I’m not sure it’s durable
• red color is meh
• the super light plastic used, ie, for the clips connecting tarp/inner tent/fly seem a bit fragile
• I still haven’t figured out a way to keep the porch stable (with a little bit of wind the poles collapse to the ground)
• if you’re setting up in the rain you’ll get the inside wet (that’s a big pro of single wall tents like the Tarptent)
• if you’re breaking down camp in the rain you’ll get the inside wet when you remove the rain fly (unless there’s someone who can help to lift 2 sides as once).

Overall, though, I’d recommend this tent (unless you want something even lighter and don’t mind having a less livable tent).
review.name: Big fan of this tent

review.reviewBody:
The new Copper Spur HV UL 3 is easily one of the best 3 season tents on the market. Light weight, durable construction, and impressively simple to set up and take down. Sheds rain nicely without water bouncing back up into the main tent body much at all.

My first overnight experience with this was a success and I look forward to really putting it to the test over the next few months and testing the durability!
review.name: Exceeded My Expectations!

name: Copper Spur HV UL3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: I use my older ferrosi's for spring skiing and alpine hikes. My older ferrosi's were too tight around the hips in a size large (155 pounds) so I sized up to an XL and that helped, but still a little restrictive around the hips (but too long in the arms) I wear my ferrosi's with usually one layer underneath and the OR Cirque softshell pants. So I ordered this new ferrosi style in an XL and it was huge around the hips! Really surprised. But I have to return it, this time an XL was way too big. I wish OR would tell us if the fit has changed so I could've ordered a smaller size. The blue color also is a bit of a grayish blue unlike the photo, and not my favorite shade. I have to return it unfortunately.
review.name: Runs big in a size XL

review.reviewBody: I love this helmet.  I have a very small head, so it's been hard to find a helmet that fits properly.  It has all the features I want without being too "sporty", if that makes sense.  It's pretty low profile and doesn't look too big on my head.  I love the vents and the fleece padding/lining inside.  The ear pads are easily removed so I can fit my outdoor tech speakers inside and there's even holes so the sound quality is better.  I love the goggle snap back, it's much better and more secure than my anon helmet.  I have Anon WM3 goggles and they fit perfectly with this helmet.  Overall 10/10, very comfortable to wear and it looks cute.
review.name: Amazing Helmet

review.reviewBody: I think my head is too round for this one.
review.name: Looked great, not right fit

review.reviewBody: These helmets are rad! But it's extremely small. Real tight on the temple. I bought a M/L and couldn't even get it on. Unfortunately they don't have an XL
review.name: Soo small

review.reviewBody:
I was excited to see the POC Kortal helmet go on sale (non-MIPS) because I always wanted one but their price were always above average.  So when I saw they went on sale I grabbed one.  
When the order arrived, I wasn't disappointed at the quality and feel of the actual helmet.  I've own Bell, Giro and Fox all good helmets on their own, but the POC exuded quality and better strapping and padding materials.  
Unfortunately, the fit is not consistent with their size chart.  I ordered the medium after looking up their size chart but the actual helmet could not accommodate my round head.  It's more for oval shape heads and even with the adjustable fit, it's a no go.  I have to send it back for an exchange to a large and now their sale is over.
review.name: Quality product

review.reviewBody: The Kortal ran on the smaller size. I purchased a medium size (54-58) as I have another POC helmet that ran medium (55-59).  However on trying it on, the Kortal was way smaller and placing pressure on the side of forehead and temple.
review.name: Size not the same as other POC helmet

review.reviewBody: For $200 you get what you pay for. Nice helmet. Good fit. Comfortable and secure. For less than half the price I paid for the POC Mips helmet you can get a Giro Mips Helmet that looks and feels the same and comes in nice bright colors.
review.name: Top of the line bicycle helmet

name: Kortal Helmet

review.reviewBody: I loved this jacket. I mostly wore it around town. It was perfect -- light weight, stretchy, and water resistant while still being breathable. Three months in, the little plastic piece that holds the bottom of the zipper together broke off. So disappointing.
review.name: Great jacket - until the zipper busted

review.reviewBody: Nice product for wind and water proof
review.name: Good gear any good experience

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable for those early cool morning hikes and breathes well when it warms up.
review.name: Hiking jacket

review.reviewBody: This is an awesome jacket but the new version has too many changes compared to the older version. It's missing the thumb holes; the hood was more adjustable previously with 2 adjusting straps in the front; the zipper pull is smaller and not as strong. I own 4 of these in the older version and was hoping to get another color but the new version has changed too much. I'll wait for another update before purchasing another one.
review.name: Bring Back Old Version

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect jacket for hiking on drizzly days. I weigh 140 and I'm 5'6", and a size small fit perfectly with room for a slim layer underneath.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: I have 4 of the older version of this jacket and I love them. I ordered this new version and the quality has declined. The zipper pulls are now smaller and are lower quality. This is new version also does not have thumb holes. Bring back the thumbholes! The fit is also different compared to the older versions. Please bring back the fit/zippers/thumbholes of the 2021 version!
review.name: Bring Back Old Version with Thumb Holes

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I love this coat for spring and summer weather. It breathes very well, but still provides some wind and rain resistance. It's very abrasion resistant: I wear it on every alpine climbing trip and it has held up great. I really appreciate the drop pockets in the new version.
review.name: I live in this coat all summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't tried it yet but it looks good
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket, very comfortable, easy to move in, lightweight, pretty much great overall. I have had it for a year (purchased in March 2022) great for hiking, traveling, running errands. My one CON is the cuffs of the sleeves. There is no cuff, either elastic or Velcro that I can tighten to keep the sleeves from hanging over my hands. I find the sleeves get in the way on this jacket unlike other athletic/active jackets I have. I am constantly pushing the sleeves up or I roll the cuff edge up to get them out of my way. I just checked if the 2023 model might have been updated to improve the sleeves but it doesn't appear so. It would be the perfect jacket with this improvement! (A note on fit - I wrote a little large. I am typically a Small but in OR jackets/shirts I am between S and XS, the S fits at my hip, the XS fits at my shoulders/chest. I am 5'5 120 lb, athletic build. I purchased the Ferrosi in XS but it is a little snug at the hip in jeans, not in running tights.)
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I use this jacket when I'm playing pickle ball when it's a little chilly outside.
review.name: Great jacket for outdoor activities

name: Ferrosi Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn this hoodie a few times, and am very happy with it. The sleeves are long enough, and the hood works well to keep the sun off my head, neck, and ears. I also like the fabric: it feels good and doesn’t get stinky as fast as synthetics do.
review.name: Great sun hoodie

review.reviewBody:
PRO
- Breathable and cooling feeling which is nice.

CON
- Could not wash out sweat stains from neck area (the stains look like white bleached out areas in the fabric) after the first hike. I have tried stain remover,  combination of white vinegar, dish soap, baking soda, hydrogen peroxide. It looks much worse than the photo shows and Never happened to my other sun hoodie. I am concerning because this is only one wear. What if the more I wear the more stains it gets. I wish I can get my money back if this is the case. Will given an update after a couple of more wear.
review.name: could not wash out sweat stains

review.reviewBody: You can’t see it in the photo but the natural has a weird topo map pattern on it. I was hoping for a nice mundane sunshirt. It didn’t fit me too great, too clingy, felt it surely would be stifling in humid heat at least for me being presently swollen from steroid medication so I am exchanging in favor of a more active cooling product like OR Activelce. I could not really size up to solve my issue but most people love this particular line from Patagonia.
review.name: Natural has a weird pattern

review.reviewBody: I recently went on a hike in the northeast and it performed great! It’s very cooling to the touch and fits very well. I sized down because they run a little larger. My usual size is a M but a S fits perfectly on me.
review.name: Very comfortable

name: Tropic Comfort Natural Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These were perfect for our Colorado trip! My daughter liked how easy it was to grip things with these gloves. So happy I got these!
review.name: Great for kids!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These gloves work well for colder weather. They aren't waterproof, which I understood. Would buy again.
review.name: Good purchase!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this gloves for my son and it's not so warm to ski but is good to wear in the winter.
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits very well on my daughter. She loves it!
review.name: I would buy this again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality glove. You won't be disappointed
review.name: Great buy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was excited to get these great looking gloves to go with the Northface green camo hat, new cropped vest and black full length jacket for my grandson. However when he put them on he wouldn't wear them. Said they hurt. Much to my surprise when I turned one of the gloves inside out I saw a variety of labels. Care, size and material content. The labels were HUGE and irritating. They took up the entire inside of the glove. Who thought that was a good idea for a 5 year old? Bought $1,000 of Northface products for all my grandkids...this was a big disappointment.
review.name: Little Kids Gloves

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought the XXS for my 3 year old and they are perfect. She can finally play outside and have warm hands. Yahoo! We have tried mittens and they just don't work for a toddler who is trying to play. I will be buying another pair for our 2 year old. Worth every penny.
review.name: 10/10 for Littles

review.reviewBody: This harness is comfortable for a full day in the alpine. I spent 16+ hours wearing this harness scrambling, alpine trad climbing, rappelling, and doing some sketchy snow crossings. While a bit heavier than some of the Petzl options it’s 100% worth it for the comfort.
review.name: My new favorite alpine harness

review.reviewBody: This harness is a great lightweight harness. the bigger loops in the front really accommodate all the gear I want. the only downside is that all day use is somewhat uncomfortable as the thin waste band digs into your waist.
review.name: Great lightweight harness

review.reviewBody: I bought this harness because I wanted a low weight, compact harness for mountain guiding and glacier travel. It worked perfectly and was super comfortable to wear while traversing the glacier even with my backpack on. Also, in general it is a really comfortable harness to wear for top rope and gym lead. I haven't used it for sport or trad yet, but I'll update when I have.

I originally got this harness for ice climbing as it has 6 different ice tool clipper spots (on both sides, 12 total) of the waist. This allowed me to put my ice tool clippers exactly where I wanted them versus where they have to be on other harnesses. It is very lightweight with functional gear loops. 
I recently took it alpine climbing and it felt awesome having it on all day, even through the more scrambly areas of the climb. Would highly recommend especially for women that have a bigger chest or hips and need to put ice tool clippers in specific spots in order to see them. I have a Large which works great with winter layers but I could have also fit a medium. I am 5'6" and 170 lbs.
review.name: Amazing, versatile lightweight harness

review.reviewBody:
I originally got this harness for ice climbing as it has 6 different ice tool clipper spots (on both sides, 12 total) of the waist. This allowed me to put my ice tool clippers exactly where I wanted them versus where they have to be on other harnesses. It is very lightweight with functional gear loops. 
I recently took it alpine climbing and it felt awesome having it on all day, even through the more scrambly areas of the climb. Would highly recommend especially for women that have a bigger chest or hips and need to put ice tool clippers in specific spots in order to see them. I have a Large which works great with winter layers but I could have also fit a medium. I am 5'6" and 170 lbs.
review.name: Amazing, versatile lightweight harness

review.reviewBody: Superlight weight if thats what you are going for; its so light it almost seems not as hearty as other harnesses; especially for hauling lots of cams. I would size up if you are female; legs are not adjustable

Somehow this harness has less padding and is lighter weight than the Ophir slide or the black diamond momentum harness, but is actually more comfortable when sitting in it for a long time. I'd highly recommend if you have a bit more money to throw in for a harness that you want to be lightweight and still comfy. Fits true to size.
review.name: Surprisingly comfy

review.reviewBody: Amazin harness which is surprisingly comfortable and does not consume any space in the backpack. I am using it for trad climbing. I climb with 14 cams, 12 slings, and three sets of nuts/tricams. I also carry cordlette, belay device and bunch of lockers. All these can be comfortably clipped to the harness. The front gear loops are bigger and the gear is easy to unclip/clip. I use the front gear loops for cams and draws. The rear loops I use for nuts, lockers and belay devices. The harness has also a small gear loop at the rear in the middle. I use this for the nut tool and sometimes the radio. The harness feels good on my body and I don't even feel it while climbing. The only little thing I found is the seem in front without any padding pushing against my bones. I did not experience it with my previous harness ocun Ego. Anyway, it is not too annoying and I might get used to it very soon.

name: Eiger Nordwand Harness

review.reviewBody: This is toasty warm and love the color.
review.name: Very warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Item itself is fine; color matches the photo well and it’s a soft material. Only negative was the draw string arrived coming undone.
review.name: Quality matched the price

review.reviewBody: They fit nicely on both my Adult children’s Helmets and my helmet. We think a better design might be to have the pull string at the net rather than around Mouth area.
review.name: warm

review.reviewBody: Wasn't sure the balaclava would do want I needed. It performs flawlessly in adverse conditions. Fits me well and kept me warmer than I excepted to be. I'll be buying another color in the future.
review.name: Really a thing to have in wind and cold!

review.reviewBody: I was excited to try this neck fleece on my recent trip to Colorado. I was so disappointed. First off it is so suffocating to the point of claustrophobia! But that wouldn't be so bad if it actually kept my neck/head warm. The wind flew right thru the fabric, no wind protection at all, I might as well not have had it on. I strongly advise against buying this item.
review.name: total fail

review.reviewBody: I was really excited to wear this over my ski helmet. I ordered the purple and loved the color but when I tried to put it on over my helmet it was way too tight. Sad I cannot use it for skiing
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: Reviews said ok for over helmet which is what I’m looking for. We use another brand balaclava for breathablity. Wanted an over helmet for extra warmth. This balaclava does not at all it over a child size helmet. Over helmet is too tight and the mouth cover sits too high. Alone as a balaclava is too loose and makes wearing a helmet properly impossible.
review.name: big as balaclava and small over helmet

review.reviewBody: Color says "Whisper White" its a cream/ yellowish color. Quality seems fine but I specifically ordered it because its listed as white.
review.name: Color not as described

review.reviewBody: so cozy and fits great. not using it with a helmet though. just keeping neck head face warm when outside on chilly days. 10/10 for a female average size head.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I think the review title says it all.  I got this as the carry-on companion to my 90 or 95L. Same color. The big one has been on East African photo safari three times and it's held up well while looking quite adventure-ready in the fiery orange red color.  I used this small one a few weeks ago and was pleasantly surpised by how much I could fit inside.
review.name: Capacious Lightweight, great Orange

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The pack its self feels tuff and capable. I have been using for 2 works as my everyday work bag (medical). The carrying straps are robust and much more comfortable then the older addition of this bag, which where uncomfortable enough that I simply carried it with a duffel strap.

I would give this bag 5 stars, but there is one downside to this bag. In the previous model there was a great side pocket on the outside that was wonderful for organization. For smaller items I want kept separate this was a Boone.

Overall great pack.
review.name: The pack its self feels

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great everyday/weekend pack. It fits everything I need, is easy to transport, and keeps everything dry, as I recently experienced during a tropical storm. As a duffel, it is very easy, and "pack-n-go." When I convert it into a backpack, I need to remain cognizant of how the contents are placed because since there is no back support, items will collapse and drag in the back. For me (I'm 5'6), the pack as a backpack turns into a "C" shape, with the top of the "C" touching my shoulders and the bottom of the "C" resting entirely on my buttocks. However, I am NOT suggesting that the pack should have a back support because I think it would ruin the versatility of the pack itself. I rate this pack 4.5 stars.
review.name: Great everyday/weekend pack. It fits

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this bag. Took it to Scotland on planes, trains, and automobiles. It was my primary luggage and held everything I needed for 2 weeks. I'm constantly amazed at how much I can put in this bag and still meet airline carry on requirements. It is my go-to duffel for quick trips or longer overseas trips where minimalist packing and convenience is required.
review.name: Best Duffel Ever

review.reviewBody: I liked the size and the weather protection as well as the ability to change to a backpack. I used this as my carry on 'stuff' bag because my other carryon was a very full camera bag. I also used this everyday in Alaska while I was dropping and adding back layers of clothes. What drove me crazy was having to change back and forth between the little end pouch where I stashed my small stuff to the main compartment opening where I needed to grab or put away a jacket. I honestly thought mine was put together backwards until I looked again at the website.
review.name: Nice, but Irritating

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We needed a smaller duffel bag for travel and this one is perfect!
review.name: We needed a smaller duffel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Solid, holds up well to travel, the backpack straps are convenient. Wish they wouldn't have entirely removed the standard duffle handles, but I had no trouble just using one of the four side bars. Works as a carry-on, though it's so portable I wish I got a size bigger just in case.
review.name: Solid, holds up well to

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Stays put, holds what I need, and looks great on the bicycle or motorcycle.
review.name: Stays put, holds what I

review.reviewBody: I work in LE and travel a lot. This is a rugged bag and is the perfect size for a carry-on. I would like to have a laptop compartment, but I know that this bag is not designed for business travel. Even so, I love it.
review.name: Great all-round travel bag

review.name: Where is the strap??

review.reviewBody: These are almost excellent. They are very well made, with a nice feel to the materials. I love that they are lightweight. They are more comfortable than the others I tried on, including the Alpina Alaska, which felt very boxy and heavy and stiff. The amount of sole flex is perfect and allows a good diagonal stride. They feel supportive, which makes quick maneuvers to avoid obstacles very confident. But I got some heal blisters on one foot (feel are slightly different). The footbed overall feels very constrained, and I have narrow feet. After experimenting with different sock combinations (thinner socks worked best), I replaced the insoles with very thin ones, and that did the trick. It's like when they designed it, they forgot to account for the volume of the insole but still put them in anyway. With the stock insoles, the pinch point that holds the heal in place was too low which caused the rubbing and the blister. With this change, they are now fine. Also a small point is that the ring near the toe that receives the hook of your gaiters is too narrow and mine can go in, but difficult to remove. My gaiters are from the 1990s so it wouldn't surprise me if modern ones have no issue.
review.name: almost excellent
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: I am determined to make these boots work for me. The toe box and arch support are excellent. I have wide feet with a bunion and very high arches and I am pleased with the fit and comfort in this part of the boot. I don't need to use my insoles. They are warm and sturdy. So much to like. The catch is that they give me terrible blisters on the back of my heels. I've tried two different sizes (the first one one purchased at my local ski shop was too big). I've tried breaking them in slowly. I've tried thick socks. I've tried thin socks. Nothing seems to help. Now I just tape my heels with moleskin before I head out and am only lacing the lower part of the boot up to my ankle. I've only tried this twice for shorter skis and it seems OK so far. It does not compromise the function of the boot in tame terrain. Hard to say how this will impact performance in challenging conditions. The new skin on my heels is still very thin and delicate, so I am hoping this gets better as they toughen up. Overall this is a fantastic boot and I'd give it 5 stars if not for the blister issue.
review.name: Fabulous, except...
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Super nice shirt! Soft, comfortable and good looking!
review.name: Loving this

review.reviewBody: I’ve bought every single color of this Tshirt, that proves how much I love them. Patagonia finally went with relaxed fit and I couldn’t be happier! The material is soft enough for being fully recycled and it feels like these tshirts are going to last for a long time.
review.name: Perfect tshirt and stylish

review.reviewBody:
Patagonia?s large slim fit tees fit me perfectly. This shirt was not available in a slim fit so I went with the regular large. 

When I first tried on the shirt...holy mackarels..I was much surprised. Either I had shrunk in the past couple days or this shirt was made for a human shaped like Spongebob Squarepants. 

That being said I went down to the Medium and it worked out just fine but it still is a little boxy and a little tight in the shoulders.
review.name: Sponge Bob square pants

review.reviewBody: The shirt is extremely big I?m a 5?10? male weigh 165 and usually wear a medium. This shirt is not true to size looks like a dress on me, sleeves go past my elbow and is super box shaped also not soft like other Patagonia shirts. I wish the company would do something about it.
review.name: Don?t get this Shirt

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite short-sleeved t-shirt. Even after frequent washing, the clothes are not deformed and the color is the same! I want to have a lot of other colors too!
review.name: i love patagonia!!!!

review.reviewBody: Bought a medium for my son. Definitely not a medium, sized more like a large. My son has two other Patagonia t-shirts in this same design in medium and this shirt is significantly larger than either of them. Returning.
review.name: Mis-sized

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using black diamond trek poles for hunting and hiking for years and the alpine carbon are by far the lightest rugged pole I’ve ever used.
review.name: Trek poles

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my wife (for Christmas) to replace a really old pair of Black Diamond hiking poles. So they haven’t been used yet but they are beautifully designed and incredibly lightweight. I would highly recommend them!
review.name: Amazing Poles

review.reviewBody: Great poles, light and the cork grip is a nice added touch.
review.name: Great Poles

review.reviewBody: Not the lightest or the most collapsible poles for sure. I have used these for years because I think they are some of the least likely poles to fail on me in the backcountry and are fairly light. I depend on my poles when climbing, hiking, and camping(trekking pole tent). These poles are also easy to manipulate in the cold, when frozen, and with gloves on.
review.name: Fantastic quality and durability

review.reviewBody: These poles were a great addition to my hiking favorites. The rigidity of the poles, with their lightweight swing makes them especially helpful after hours of tracking. Nice work BD!
review.name: Pole Power

review.reviewBody: This things are light and solid. Clasps hold the pole sections tight. Cork grips absorb a little moisture and have great grip. The best.
review.name: Best Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: These are the best. Seriously, the locking mechanism is strong and doesn’t shift when putting weight on it. The carbon material is light and comfy. The poles are comfy in my hands and all in all an excellent purchase. Just did 14 miles with them yesterday and 2500 feet of climb and they were bomber! Yes…. . you will love them! Great job on these BD!
review.name: So good! Should have bought them sooner

review.reviewBody:
super solid and reliable
appreciate the good clamps to hold sections tightly
review.name: great poles

review.reviewBody: Nicely designed grips and locks. They feel practically weightless while hiking. I wish the hand straps were a little more supple.
review.name: Excellent trekking poles

review.reviewBody:
Bought these because I have seen them used by others for years and had great things to say.
I immediately took them out on a pretty grueling set of hikes in the south in some karst landscapes that would put a beating on any pole. They handled so well and felt so sturdy which was exactly what saved me a few times. I installed the screw on rubber tips which was an amazing adaptable feature to have and they helped going from rock to soft ground and back constantly! The straps and cork handle felt just right around my wrists and hands. I’m just super happy with these.
review.name: Loving these poles!

hasVariant.name: Varia RVR315 Rearview Radar
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Varia RVR315 Rearview Radar online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I never ever go on a solo ride without this. Great way to keep tabs on traffic coming from behind. Downside - the beep from my Garmin 530 so usually don't hear it. I glance down at the 530 to check for the on-screen traffic indicators coming from this radar. Maybe 20% of the time I get passed by a car that I never noticed coming.

Read a review where there is a phone app for this. Maybe if I felt the phone vibrate through my jersey I would know to look down at the Garmin and check traffic.

Once I know traffic is coming, I either turn my head back to know where they are going or I watch from a mirror. If a car from behind isn't slowing or moving over, I will get off the road. I have never had a traffic safety issue thanks to this radar.

I have had this for 2 years now with no problems. Battery life isn't super long. Maybe enough for two 3-hour rides. I make sure to charge before most rides, especially if its a 3+ hour ride.
review.name: A must for solo rides

review.reviewBody:
When I saw my friends with their Garmin Varia, I viewed it as as another bling gadget, likely to be more distracting than useful. But they swear by theirs. 

When I saw the RVR315 for about 1/2 price of the regular Varia, I figured it was worth a try. I use a FLY6 rear-viewing camera, so I didn?t need the light. 

Half way through my first ride, I was hooked. Main reason: I glance at my Garmin Edge 530 often thanks to riding with a power meter (Vector 3). I realized that with every glance, I was getting an instant traffic alert. I figure that knowledge pays for the device. Knowing for some of the time, whether or not cars are behind you is better than not knowing for most of the time.

Some details:
- The mobile phone app works well. By connecting with Bluetooth, it works in parallel to the bike computer. I can?t hear the beep from my Edge 530, so I pair my phone to my hearing aids. The wanting sound is not unpleasant. I can live with it, but the feature isn?t needed on busy roads, so I?ll likely use it when riding alone in the local hills and on rural stretches.
- The phone vibration option has no effect. I can?t detect the vibration through my jersey so I just turn that off.
- Varia pairs with Garmin?s own smart watch, but there?s no iPhone Watch app. That could use the haptic feature. Hope it?s in the works.
- The dots can be configured to appear on the left or right of the Edge 530 (and higher models).
- The color over-bars can be removed if they obscure the Edge screen, as it does for my cycling dynamics.
- Turning off the Garmin will also turn off the radar. Nice. But turning on the Garmin doesn?t turn on the radar as it does on the larger Varia model. The forums claim that it should. Need to investigate. 
- The most important item on my list to figuring out how to mount both the Radar and the Fly6. It?s a must-do. The Fly6 has been indispensable. I?ve used it to report dangerous drivers to the CHP.
- My integrated seat post isn?t a great shape for the Varia mount due to the aero shape. Not Garmin?s fault. I need to experiment with attaching it under the saddle.
I think The Varia315 is great value for the price. 
Hope this helps.
review.name: Exceeds Expectations

name: Varia RVR315 Rearview Radar
