review.reviewBody: I tried several pairs of these and finally gave up thinking maybe it was a defect. If you dont have really Slim feet these are not for you. I work un a chicken plant where the temperature is 36 degrees. These boots are  just not warm at all. Found a good insulated sock but then my feet wouldn’t go in. The end of my day i clean thr floors with a squeegee prepping for sanitation. This was the next problem. These are 100 percent not water proof. If im standing still on my line of course they are fine besides being cold and uncomfortable from squeezing my toes together. I wouldn’t recommend these boots to anyone who ask me about them at the chicken factory I worked at.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment:
Hello Kris,
Sorry to hear about your issues with these boots.  Please reach out to our customer care team.  Also it sounds like you may need one of our insulated legacy styles for your needs. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: These boots are so cute! I wore them with shorts when my family and I went creek fishing for trout. My feet stayed nice and dry. Was my first time wearing them and they were very comfortable. Not heavy, but they feel durable, like they'll last.They also look cute with a pair of jeans. Cant wait for winter so i can wear them more often. My husband loved how they looked on me, I got a compliment from him real quick😉 I'm a 8.5 and purchased a 9. They fit good
review.name: Look just as cute on as they do online

review.reviewBody: I was warned to order a size up because I have wider feet and they fit small. That was wrong. A size 9 would've been perfect. However these are the best shoes I've had yet working in an autoshop. My feet don't hurt and I don't slip. It's Fantastic
review.name: 10/10 BUT BUY YOUR EXACT SIZE

review.reviewBody: Not true to size - I’m a solid 9 in boots and these fit more like 8-8.5
review.name: Runs small
comment:
Hello Sandy G,
Sorry to hear you are not satisfied with your new boots and that they are too small.  We do offer a 1 year limited warranty.  Please reach out if you need any assistance.  We appreciate your support.
xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: They will work for me to wear to and from work, but I wouldn't wear these all day long. I wouldn't think of wearing them without socks that go up past your ankles.
review.name: Very Cute, but NOT Comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Love these, they are indestructible.  I love these boots so much.  I highly recommend them.  They're waterproof and look great.
review.name: Great boot - nice and durable

review.reviewBody: So comfortable! Not only keeps my feet warm and dry, but they're really cute!
review.name: Great purchase!

review.reviewBody:
Was so disappointed that the boots felt heavy and hurt my feet. Even without the shoestrings being fully tightened, the front of my toes would go numb after walk a few minutes and then after loosening the strings more, not getting enough ankle support I could feel my toes again. I had read other reviews about pinching in the back of the foot and I had hoped that after a couple more wears it would stop but with more wears it just made the rubbing to blister happen faster. Before I could walk in them for 40+ min, and now after 10 my foot begins to blister and numb. These shoes def are not too small for my feet. 
This came so highly recommended that I made the investment and I’m sad that after a year I’m going to have to throw them out. 
Seems like there is product inconsistency too which is another disappointment.
review.name: Disappointing & ouch
comment:
Hello,
Sorry to hear that these boots did not fit as expected.  Please reach out to us xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com.

review.reviewBody:
Oh my gosh where to begin. I love this brand. The sizing is so off. I have the 15 inch tall boots and wear a solid 6 in those and every other brand of shoes I own. I bought a different pair of rain boots from xtratuf  that ran really big so those ones I had to get in a 5.5, these ones are a 6 and are way too small! My toe is touching the end. I also have salmon sister deck shoes that fit perfectly in a size 6. 
 I am going to order the size 7, but I feel like jumping up a whole size isn’t going to work but I am being hopeful. I absolutely love the other shoes and boots from this brand. 
They are very cute, and otherwise exactly what I was hoping for just two small and very stiff in the ankle.
review.name: I wish but they are not comfortable! Sizing is off
comment:
Hello,
If you would like an exchange, please call Customer Service at 1-866-442-4908.  We want you to be 100% satisfied with your purchase!

review.reviewBody: These boots are cute but as many of the other reviews warned, they are extremely uncomfortable. The stitching is super thick and stiff and the instep too low. This means that the seam presses the top of my foot and my toes go numb from my nerves being cut off.
review.name: Uncomfortable!
comment:
MarciT,
Please reach out to 1-855-377-BOOT (2668) so we can help guide you on a boot that will fit your needs! Thanks for the review.

description: Buy the Thule Roundtrip MTB Case online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Roundtrip MTB Case
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Roundtrip MTB Case online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Thule roundtrip bag from Backcountry after a lot of research, conversations and comparisons. I wanted to make sure that I purchased the right bag for my bike. Protection, portability and ease of use were all vital.  Thule roundtrip was the bag.  I unboxed it after it arrived and did a test fit with my bike (Ripmo v2 size XL).  It fit securely in the bag with room to spare with one exception.  It was necessary to remove the rear derailleur which was slightly disappointing because I expected to not have to remove it.  Everything else was functional and high quality so removing the derailleur was a minor disappointment.  One of the last steps before zipping up everything and getting it ready for transport is attaching the handlebars.  Two straps with velcro sit to the left side of the front fork.  One of the straps was missing Velcro which made it impossible to secure the handlebars.  I went to the Backcountry site and used the chat function to share the situation with customer service because the defective strap was a dealbreaker for me.  If I spend $1,000 on a car I expect it to have warts.  If I spend $1,000 on a bike bag I expect manufacturing precision.

Sarah was the first person I chatted with.  She was understanding, sympathetic and offered to replace the defective bag with a new one.  I was quite satisfied with that proposition.  Before sending me a new bag she asked me to provide pictures of the defective part for “documentation and verification”.  I emailed the pictures to her but she couldn’t view them because my email was quarantined in her phishing folder.  We tried again.  We tried a third time.  Despite three volleys she was unable to open the emails I sent. Sarah offered to transfer me to a “bike specialist”. 

Enter Elizabeth.  I was forced to start from the beginning with Elizabeth because apparently Backcountry customer service can’t see chat history.  Or they opt not to read it.  Regardless, after getting Elizabeth up to speed she was on board with replacing my bag with a new one after the defective part was verified with photo evidence.  Elizabeth sent an email to me and asked me to reply to it with pictures attached.  I did.  She received the email with pictures attached but couldn’t open them “because of the format”.  The pictures were provided in jpeg format which happens to be the most common format for digital pictures on the planet.  Repeated attempts were unsuccessful. Elizabeth offered to transfer me to a “bike specialist”.  Wait, I thought you were a bike specialist?  Nevermind.

Enter Joe. Joe wasn’t so much a bike specialist as a hatchet man.  I asked him if it was necessary for me to start from the beginning and he took mercy on me by offering to read the chat from the start which was now running for 1 hour and 7 minutes.  Solid Joe!  Solid.  Joe quickly determined that “we don’t need to start shipping bike bags all over the country” and told me to contact Thule, the product manufacturer.  I told Joe I didn’t purchase the product from Thule & it was unlikely they would ship me a replacement.  He assured me Thule “will replace the defective part”.  I took this opportunity to clarify the situation with Joe and informed him the strap is an integrated part of the product and sewn into the wall of the bag.  He acknowledged that.  I asked him what I would do with a "replacement part". Should expect to receive a replacement strap from Thule, remove the old strap (which was attached to the bag originally with an industrial sewing machine during production) and then sew the replacement strap into the bag without damaging the bag or losing functionality?  I also shared with him that I don’t know how to sew and I don’t own any sewing equipment or supplies.  Joe said yes this is the best course of action.  

I was colossally disappointed with Backcountry customer service which consumed 90 minutes of my Sunday and left me in the exact same position as I was before I contacted them.
review.name: Thule Roundtrip/Backcountry Service

name: Roundtrip MTB Case

review.reviewBody: I like the appearance of the shoe.  The fit by the ankle was too rigid and led to some discomfort.  I’ve had a few pairs of the earlier Ghosts and prefer their fit.
review.name: Like the look but it’s an “ankle biter”

review.reviewBody: I use this shoe for walking. It isn’t as comfortable as the Ghost 15. The mesh overlay seems to make it less supportive though cooler. I am glad Brooks has significantly improved their shoe laces. These are great.
review.name: I prefer Ghost 15

review.reviewBody: Use more as a walking shoe.  Something has changed from the 15, not as comfy for the pad of foot as they were.  It may be the angle of the heal to toe, not sure.

I need extra wide shoes.  This fits really well.  But it’s so ugly it makes me hate exercising.  Can’t Brooks design a wide shoe that isn’t all black but has really simple, not obnoxious colors that would pair well with black leggings?
review.name: Great fit, looks terrible.

review.reviewBody: I am a huge Brooks fan but a running store suggested these for me. Not enough support for someone with hip issues. Ariel GTS 23 beat for those with hip issues. The Ghosts are not supportive enough. I think I am over the time frame to return and do not have box.
review.name: Hip Support

review.reviewBody: They don’t feel the same as my previous pairs of Brooks. I used to love getting a new pair and it felt like I was walking on clouds and a perfect fit. These feel like they are not made well, they gap at my ankles and don’t feel like they are well made.
review.name: Something has changed

review.reviewBody: Very cushy and the toe box is large enough to accommodate my arthritic big toe. I have walked miles & miles on cobblestone streets , many times with no toe pain at all!
review.name: I can walk for miles & miles!

review.reviewBody: These are so light, such a great fit just what my back needed.
review.name: Light shoe Great fit

review.reviewBody: I just got back into running a few months ago and this is my first pair of Ghosts since the 8. Very happy with them! So far I have only been on treadmill runs. Support is perfect. Have not found any spots that rub or are uncomfortable. My ONLY request is to please make the laces about 3-4 inches longer!
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes!  They go for miles right out of the box.  Good cushioning, good support.
review.name: My go-to shoes

name: Ghost 16 Wide Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have four of these dresses! I love the fact they are comfortable and versatile. They never wrinkle so packing and traveling is perfect.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a gift and I  wasn’t sure what to expect but this dress is very well made and the print is absolutely charming. This person travels extensively and I know this lightweight dress will be perfect for warmer locales and will pack without wrinkles or take up much room in her suitcase. The sale price was great too!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfy and easy to wear!  Love the color and style… fits right in with my busy day of teaching high school.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful color and fabric; wrinkle free; perfect to travel with. Only wish it had pockets.

review.reviewBody: I am 5'4 and about 125 pounds and a medium WOULD work for me if I didn't have larger breasts! I loved everything about the dress but that...and that is a major NO for me so it is going back.  I also didn't like that there is a visible tag on the OUTSIDE back of the dress, so if you have short hair you will have a triangle tag  visible

review.reviewBody: I've used these in-bounds, backcountry, and winter hiking in the cold and heavy wet snow of New England. The material feels durable, I have no doubt that they'll hold up for years to come. The full zip is nice. Ventilation is good. My only complaint is the lack of pockets-only two front pockets, nothing in the lower part of the leg or butt-which is a bummer for those that like to carry a bit more on their person, but probably decreases the likelihood of failure somewhere in the fabric. I still give them a solid 5/5.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: Love these bibs for backcountry skiing. Lightweight and durable.
review.name: Well built

review.reviewBody:
I live and work in the Cascade mountains of WA state.  The snow is plentiful and moist so we really need every bit of water resistance we can get.

These pants match that need and then some.  They are burly, but not too heavy.  Functional without being overly complicated.  These will be my go-to pants every day that I am not in uniform.  Being Mammut, I know that they will last for many ski days.
review.name: Great inbounds hardshell

review.reviewBody: These pants breathe well, they are waterproof and they're very durable.
review.name: Beyond expectations

review.reviewBody:
Shoping for ice climbing pants was difficult. I was looking to stay dry but to also have a fit that would allow me high steps while not getting caught in my crampons on steep snow.

These pants have all I needed. First they are ultralight, they are as water resistant as it gets and they are made to move with you during your climbing. I was impressed how it felt like I was wearing nothing while climbing. 

I climb in the northeast, in very cold conditions and often very wet. So softshell is just not cutting it. These pants fits great and are exactly what I needed.

They are pricy and it hurts when I make a new crampon tear but they are so worth it.
review.name: Best pants

review.reviewBody: Have used these pants for several ski tours and alpine ice climbing trips now, and was very impressed by the breathability and durability.  I found they fit true to size, even with light base layers underneath, and they haven't hindered my movement.  I've only used them for spring/summer mountaineering so far, and the side zips work pretty well for venting heat during high output activity.  There may be better options if you're exclusively a skier, but if you are also an alpine climber these are a great option.
review.name: Great pants for ice climbing and ski touring

review.reviewBody: These pants are solid. Ice climber. Definitely overkill for most things I get up to, but I'd rather be over dressed than the latter. Would like to see improvements on abrasion resistance, but not unsatisfied with current performance. If I were to order again, I would size up to help accommodate for layers.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: Love the durability and waterproof finish. Also very breathable and great for longer tours in wet conditions. Not the lightest, so not ideal for high output. More a high mountain and weatherproof package.
review.name: Amazing Pant

review.reviewBody: Very surprised by the quality of these pants. I've used them for telemark skiing and ski touring, good fit and comfortable.

I was looking for Gore-Tex Pro pants to replace my 5 year old 3L ones that looked polka dot from all the patches. These have a great fit and are very warm even without any insulation. I wear 32 jeans and ordered size 34 in these to account for wearing insulated pants underneath which was the perfect choice. When extra insulation isn't needed, the waist adjusters work perfectly to make them fit. I'm not a fan of the suspenders for skiing and we will see how durable the Pro material is. I hope to get at least 6 years out of these and will report back on their durability.
review.name: Great Pants

name: Nordwand Pro HS Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Really poorly thought-out bag. I have and heavily use other dry duffles including a Patagonia Black Hole and the equivalent REI bag, so I was stoked to find this even larger size waterproof bag (I bought 2). Unfortunately, it has significant flaws.

First, none of the straps tuck. The shoulder/backpack straps are permanently attached at one end, but there's no pocket nearby. The center shoulder strap likewise detaches at only one end, and instead of a pocket has a fiddly Velcro roll-keeper strap - so even when folded, it's still a floppy little nub flapping around on one end of the bag. 

Second, this bag has effectively no way to carry it comfortably in one hand (!). Unlike basically every other duffel, the Camp 4 has no center-mounted straps, only straps that connect at each end. It has backpack straps and the center shoulder strap (full length), and that's it - so the closest thing it has to a pair of regular carry handles is the shoulder straps (also full length). So if carrying horizontally, the bag immediately 'tacos' in the middle and basically drags on the ground.

This means that effectively the bag has only a two 'shoulder' carry modes, and no 'hand carry' mode. Again, truly astounding for a duffel bag from a major manufacturer.
review.name: How do you mess up a *duffel* bag? Mind-boggling!

name: Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag

Do not buy these.

review.reviewBody: the material was perfect for warm weather, however, the size ran small.     my normal size was a little tight on the waist, however was much too tight on the legs.    returned for one size up.  hoping for a relaxed fit on the legs,  (note, I have thin legs, so was surprised at the tight fit which is why I deducted 2 stars)
review.name: runs small

review.reviewBody: I’ll start by saying I love the fit of these pants. The fabric is great. For 100 dollars though, the button system is horrible. I’m 6’1, 175 lbs, and whenever I bend over, sit down, or stick my hand in the pocket the button clasp unbuttons. I tried on different waist sizes and the size up is way too big, and the size down is too tight to squeeze on. Just a terrible design. Every other tactical pant has a much better design and you’ll save a few bucks.
review.name: Poor clasp design

review.reviewBody: I just got the same size pants (32x30) in another style of Kuhl pants.  The other ones fit fine, but these were too tight.  Now I have to pay to return ship because of Kuhl's inconsistency.  Not KUHL.
review.name: Disappointed - The size was too small.

review.reviewBody: Look nice and can be dress casual. But also ideal for a fall hike or work in the woods, great pants!
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: And these pants are the best pants ever made.  Extremely lightweight, breathable, and stretch where you need them especially in the plumber b.u.t.t. area if you suffer from that.  I now have 5 pairs and will probably never wear jeans again.
review.name: My first review I've ever written.

review.reviewBody: This is the third pair I?ve bought as a gift. He absolutely loves them and is what he always asks for. He wears them everywhere and says they are so comfortable.
review.name: Awesome pants!

review.reviewBody: Love Kuhl products.  These are comfortable and stylish but also great for the field.  Wish some pockets had zippers.  In the field you need one or two secure pockets to keep things from falling out if you're bouncing around vehicles or sliding down hillsides.  Other than that, great.
review.name: Great Pants but needs zippers

review.reviewBody: This is the second pair I?ve bought as a gift for the same person. He loves them. They are very light weight, stretchy and breathable. Was very comfy while riding on a motorcycle, fishing, hiking, you name it. You can dress them up or down. They?re great for any occasion.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: These are the best all around pants I've found for the urban professional/ outdoor enthusiast. These are lightweight, breathable in all but the balmiest conditions, and very utilitarian despite the refined look. I'm tall and trim and I find the bottom hem to be perfect on this pant. Highly recommend, awesome product!
review.name: The best

name: Radikl Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have been searching for a chamois for longer rides after my Patagonia liners fell apart . . . and I am so glad I gave these a try. The padding is a little denser than some other shorts, but that's what I was looking for as I don't plan on wearing these out and about after a ride.  These are incredibly comfortable, and not hot! The waistband isn't restrictive, and have thicker thighs and these don't move at all. I am so happy with them that I am ordering another pair now. I will be interested to see how they wear and wash (I do was my chamois frequently), but I'm hoping they stand up to the use, because I want to wear them all the time.
review.name: Super Comfy!

review.reviewBody: These are comfy for long and short rides. I like the length, no rolling or tugging at the liner. They do give a little appearance of diaper butt, but I?m not wearing these from the trail to the bar. So it doesn?t matter when your comfortable and not fidgeting on your saddle. I LOVE these shorts. They wash well, I always hang dry and so far I wash them once a week in the washer and hand wash in between for added cleanliness. I use them a lot and they have held up really nicely.
review.name: Your butt will thank you

name: Montcham Short - Women's

It’s very wide and sits very tall on my head. I think I’m going to have to wash it to shrink it or even hem a good 2in off the top. It does feel well made though and I love the color.

review.reviewBody: Not sure why Backcountry wants me to review this strap that was never shipped. I placed the order and waited a few weeks without shipping confirmation, when I reached out to see what was up I was told it hadn't gone out the door yet so I asked for the order to be cancelled. Ended up ordering the strap straight from Suunto and had it on my wrist two days later. The strap itself is excellent, the Backcountry experience not so much.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Range Splitboard - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm glad this board got a makeover. Before, it was just another twin, now it's a backcountry slayer. The difference in the sidecut is very noticeable in how much more stable the board feels and how much better it carves. I'm excited for the snow to get deeper to really push this board to it's limits.
review.name: New redesign rocks!

review.reviewBody: Great choice for those looking for an all mountain splitboard that handles well in all conditions. It's my go-to for most days in the backcountry - from powder turns, booter sessions, afternoon tours up the resort, to steeper/technical terrain with variable conditions.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: This is an amazing splitboard for those who prefer the directional twin board. Great board for those who also like to ride switch and/or prefer a more freestyle riding style. Great all-mountain board as well from powder to drops and steeps! Also a stellar company to support!
review.name: Great Choice!

review.reviewBody: the range split has been so fun over the years, its my go to daily driver because of its versatility. no matter what snow conditions or line choice i continue to grab this board out of the quiver to take out for my daily skin up resort sled - split mission to some serious terrain , or even long treks for spring camping in my backyard zone. the graphics are also pretty sweet!
review.name: go to daily driver

review.reviewBody: The Range is an awesome all around splitboard. It's my go-to on days where I want to focus on my freestyle, ride switch and look for the park features in the backcountry. Not only is it agile and playful, it also shreds powder great too. I also find the Range to be a great choice for technical splitboard mountaineering, where agility and precision with every turn matters. If you're looking to push your freestyle in the backcountry or just want a great all-around splitboard the Range is an excellent choice.
review.name: Backcountry freestyle crusher

review.reviewBody: This board does it all!  I have used it for big mountain lines, booter missions, and of course pow turns in the trees.  The camber profile works for all types of riding.  Super durable I have had it for 4 years and it's still in great condition.  If you like to ride a little bit of everything then the Range from Weston is a great fit for you!
review.name: Weston Range Splitboard

name: Range Splitboard - 2025
